Wonderfully quiet, well laid out, equipped and compact room, excellent breakfast, and helpful staff. If arriving by car, there should be no problem. Access from town without your own car is the issue. Walking the three kilometers uphill and through complex and unmarked intersections is not practical. There is no public transportation. Taxis are not always available at the train station, and Uber is not always available either. Once there, staff can call a taxi for you, and they come quickly. Price was excellent, but breakfast and any taxis have to be added in.

reviews.review_title: It was a really bad experience staying in this hotel.  The price is not worthy at all.
reviews.negative_text:
We booked an apartment for 5 people at this hotel and had a very disappointing experience. The room was located right next to a public restroom inside the hotel, and the apartment itself was extremely basic. As soon as we opened the doors to the two bedrooms, we were hit by a strong musty smell.

On the day we checked in, the temperature reached 30¬∞C. The apartment was advertised on Booking.com as having air conditioning, but there was none‚Äîjust a few basic fans. We contacted Booking.com immediately that evening and also informed the staff at the front desk. Booking‚Äôs customer service reached out to the hotel both by phone and email, but the hotel never responded.

When we checked out the next day, the hotel owner gave us a very dismissive response. He admitted they had received the complaint but said Booking.com couldn‚Äôt influence their policies. He casually stated that they had mistakenly listed the apartment as having air conditioning and would ‚Äúupdate the listing,‚Äù and that was it.

We were extremely disappointed by the hotel‚Äôs attitude. They showed no concern for guest comfort or experience, and their willingness to misrepresent the room's features is unacceptable. We strongly do not recommend staying here.

reviews.review_title: A great base from which to explore Annecy.
reviews.positive_text: Sure Hotel provided an affordable accommodation option for us, and was a great place to land overnight while on a motorbike trip through the area. Rooms are small but comfortable and clean, and the facilities were good. Parking was easily accessible and relatively secure positioned in the front of the building. We were able to explore the area using the public bus system, which was about a 15 min walk to  and from the stop. Good WiFi and comfortable beds.

No air conditioning - was fitted with air con but this was centrally disabled. It was exceedingly hot whilst we were there, so opening the window didn‚Äôt help and we couldn‚Äôt sleep with the window open. As a result, sleep was poor.

No hot water in the shower on the last morning.

Regular bus service (line 3) took us close to the hotel but then it is a 10 minute walk uphill to get to the hotel. Taxis are available but not cheap. With a car, good free parking.
